articles.author: KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Congressional leaders from both parties looked to put a positive light on a $1.2 trillion spending package that lawmakers are working to approve before funding expires at midnight Friday for a host of key government agencies.
articles.title: Congressional leaders sell $1.2 trillion spending package to members before shutdown deadline

articles.author: VALERIE GONZALEZ and LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: McALLEN, Texas (AP) — A dizzying volley of courtroom maneuvers over a Texas law that would allow the state to arrest and deport people who enter the U.S.
articles.title: Court action on Texas' migrant arrest law leads to confusion at the US-Mexico border

articles.author: ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and SUDHIN THANAWALA
articles.description: ATLANTA (AP) — The judge overseeing the Georgia 2020 election interference case cleared the way Wednesday for Donald Trump and other defendants to appeal a ruling allowing Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis to remain on the prosecution.
articles.title: Judge clears way for Trump to appeal ruling keeping Fani Willis on Georgia 2020 election case

articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel is determined to launch a ground offensive against Hamas in Rafah, Gaza's southernmost town, a plan that has raised global alarm because of the potential for harm to the hundreds of thousands of civilians sheltering there.
articles.title: Why Israel is so determined to launch an offensive in Rafah

articles.author: REGINA GARCIA CANO
articles.description: MEXICO CITY (AP) — As Venezuela’s government would have it, President Nicolás Maduro and members of his inner circle have been the target of several conspiracies since last year that could have left them injured or worse.
articles.title: As election nears, Venezuelan government keeps arresting opponents allegedly tied to criminal plots

articles.author: PIERRE-RICHARD LUXAMA
articles.description: PORT-AU-PRINCE, Haiti (AP) — Armed gangs launched new attacks in the suburbs of Port-au-Prince early Wednesday, with heavy gunfire echoing across once-peaceful communities near the Haitian capital.
articles.title: Gangs target peaceful communities in new attacks on Haiti's capital

articles.author: GRAHAM LEE BREWER and AMELIA THOMSON-DEVEAUX
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — With abortion rights poised to be one of the major issues in the 2024 election, a new poll shows that Asian Americans, Native Hawaiians and Pacific Islanders in the United States are highly supportive of legal abortion, even in situations where the pregnant person wants an abortion for any reason.
articles.title: Nearly 8 in 10 AAPI adults in US think abortion should be legal, AP-NORC poll finds

articles.author: HYUNG-JIN KIM
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — South Korea’s government will start suspending the licenses of striking junior doctors next week as they refuse to end their weekslong walkouts that burdened the country's medical services, officials said Thursday.
articles.title: South Korea will suspend the licenses of striking junior doctors starting next week

articles.author: STEFANIE DAZIO, RONALD BLUM and BETH HARRIS
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Shohei Ohtani’s interpreter and close friend has been fired by the Los Angeles Dodgers following allegations of illegal gambling and theft from the Japanese baseball star.
articles.title: Shohei Ohtani's interpreter fired by Dodgers after allegations of 'massive theft' from Japanese star

articles.author: JACOB BENGE
articles.description: DAYTON, Ohio (AP) — Jimel Cofer scored all 19 of his points in the second half and overtime and Grambling State rallied from a 14-point deficit to beat Montana State 88-81 to earn its first NCAA Tournament win in program history in the First Four on Wednesday night.
articles.title: Grambling State rallies to win its first NCAA Tournament game, beating Montana State in OT
